lines.text: The crowd laughs with you always... but it will cry with you for only a day.
Picnic my eye! I'm doing the same things I do every day!
Don't crab, dear. Everything's goin' to be roses... when my ship comes in.
Your ship? A worm must be towing it down from the North Pole!
We do not know how big the crowd is, and what opposition it is... until we get out of step with it.
Marriage is not a word, it's a *sentence*!
Look at that crowd! The poor boobs... all in the same rut!

[to Bert after passing a diorama depicting Washington crossing the Delaware]
Sit down. You don't look historical. You look hysterical.
What are you gonna be when you grow up, Whitey?
I detend to be a preacher man! Hallelujah!
I purpose to seek occupation as a cowboy
You've gotta be good in that town if you want to beat the crowd.
I've got a pair of wrens dated up for Coney Island. Want to make it a foursome?
Nothin' doin', Bert! I'm studying nights!
Aw, come on! These babies have got what ain't in books!
Well, I'll try anything once...
This night-life is my speed, Bert Old Bean! We gotta do it often!

[Making introductions]
Jane... John! John... Jane! Mary... John! John... Mary!

[Advice to Johnny as he leaves on his honeymoon]
Don't forget to pull down the shades.
Did I hear you-all speakin' 'bout havin' yo' bed made up?
Will you put the folding bed in its garage?
Oh, Gee, Baby! How did the angels ever let you leave Heaven?
Gee, but you're a great, big, good lookin' some-account man!
You'd try the patience of a Saint!
You're no soothing syrup yourself!
During the next five years two eventful things happened to the Simses. A baby sister was born... and John received an $8 raise.
This is the way I work! I'm the old go-getting kid!
I've brought home the bacon, Mary! Five hundred bucks!
Why don't you never play with me any more? I like to play with you. Doesn't Momma like you? I like you. When I grow up I wanta be just like you.
You still love me? You still believe in me, boy?
Sure I do, Pop!
We can do it, boy! We'll show them!

[laughing at a juggling clown]
The poor sap! And I bet his father thought he would be President!
